member.name: T:EPiServer.Enterprise.Internal.DefaultSiteContentInitialization
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Supports automatic setup of default site content (used by templates to bootstrap a site with content)
member.remarks: Place a file ~/App_Data/DefaultSiteContent.episerverdata on the web site to automatically import and configure a new site. Site will only be created where there are no other sites defined and there are no content under the root page beside the wastebasket.

member.name: E:EPiServer.Enterprise.Internal.DefaultSiteContentInitialization.ImportedSiteContent
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Triggered when setup process has been completed
member.remarks: This event is called inside a lock, so no other HTTP requests can be processed until all event handlers listening to this event return.

member.name: T:EPiServer.MirroringService.MirroringTransferProtocol.Common.MirroringTransferProviderBase
member.summary: The bas class for transfering mirroring job. The Mirrorring transfering protocol is based on provider base for the custom implementation should inherits this class. There are a few abstract method which be called on the instance when the mirrorin is starting The InitializeMirroring is a synchronize method which returns a MirroringStatus. If the Status is OK then the mirroring frameworks(Export component) calls other methods which are asyncronize. The communication between the MirroringFramework(Export component) and the MTP (Mirrroing transfer protocol) should be via MirroringTransferStatusEvent If there is problem in transfering an MirroringTransferStatusEvent should be fired.

member.name: T:EPiServer.MirroringService.MirroringTransferProtocol.Common.TransferQueueManager
member.summary: The main function of MirroringQueueExecuterManager class is manage the queue item (MirroringTransferData) and if the item is bigger than chunksize divide them in small packages and forwarding to the Client (IMirroringDataTransfer). It has a private queue which the owner can send action item for executing. There are three type of action 1- Initialize action tells to Client a miiroring job is initialized 2- SendPackage action sends the Mirroring job to server 3- Complete action tells to Client the mirroring job is complete 4- Clean up action clean up queue and wait to client is back from server call All actions are stored in a private queue and the menager executes them one after one. This class chunked the transfer data if the data is bigger the chunksize and send them in small packet the client.

member.name: T:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType
member.summary: Client-side events which the can attach listeners for

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.None
member.summary: No event

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Blur
member.summary: The blur event occurs when an element or window loses focus.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Change
member.summary: The change event occurs when a control loses the input focus and its value has been modified since gaining focus.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Click
member.summary: The click event occurs when a mouse button is clicked.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.ContextMenu
member.summary: The contextmenu event occurs when the user calls up a context menu.
member.remarks: Supported in some browsers by clicking right mouse button or by using keyboard shortcuts.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.DblClick
member.summary: The dblclick event occurs when the user quickly clicks the mouse twice.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Focus
member.summary: The focus event occurs when an element or window receives focus. Not all elements can get focus.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.KeyDown
member.summary: The keydown event occurs when a user presses a keyboard key.
member.remarks: In theory representing a key being pressed. Not the same in all browsers.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.KeyPress
member.summary: The keypress event occurs when a user presses a key on the keyboard.
member.remarks: In theory representing a character being typed. Not the same in all browsers.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.KeyUp
member.summary: The keyup event occurs when a user releases a key that's been pressed.
member.remarks: In theory representing a key being released. Not the same in all browsers.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.MouseDown
member.summary: The mousedown event occurs when a mouse button is pressed.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.MouseMove
member.summary: The mousemove event occurs whenever the mouse is moved.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.MouseOut
member.summary: The mouseout event occurs when the mouse leaves the current element (specified by it's boundary points).

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.MouseOver
member.summary: The mouseover event occurs when the mouse is within the current elements boundary points.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.MouseUp
member.summary: The mouseup event occurs when the user releases the mouse button

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Resize
member.summary: The resize event occurs when an element or document view is resized.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.BeforeUnload
member.summary: The beforeunload event occurs when unload event is raised and provides a way to prevent the unload.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.DragDrop
member.summary: The dragdrop event occurs when a system item (file, shortcut, etc) is dropped into the window.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Load
member.summary: The load event occurs at the end of the document loading process when all images and sub content has been loaded.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.ReadyStateChange
member.summary: The readystatechange event occurs when the readystate of a request changes.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Scroll
member.summary: The scroll event occurs when a windows scroll position is changed.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Select
member.summary: The select event occurs when some text is selected in a text field.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Submit
member.summary: The submit event occurs when a form is submitted.

member.name: F:EPiServer.ClientScript.EventType.Unload
member.summary: The unload event is raised when the document is unloaded.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.Html.TextIndexer.StripHtml(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Strip all HTML elements from a HTML string and return text.
member.param: The max text length to return.
Maximum word size osed when placing the moreTextMarker at end of string.
member.returns: A string without HTML markup.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.Html.TextIndexer.StripHtml(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Strip all HTML elements from a HTML string and return text.
member.param: Max string length to return. 0 returns all text in the HTML string.
member.returns: A string with text

remarks.para: Note that maxTextLengthToReturn will count a HTML entity as one character.
If the stripped text is longer than the specified max length, the string will be truncated and "..." appended at the end.
The algorithm in StripHTML works as follows:
Remove all tags, replacing them with a space. All whitespaces are replaced by space. All consecutive whitespaces are merged into one space.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.IContentSource.CurrentContent
member.summary: Gets the currently loaded content.
member.value: Returns information about the currently loaded content, or a content in a collection when used inside a control.

remarks.para: The implementation of CurrentContent is strictly up to the implementing class. Some of the templated Web controls implement , and CurrentContent will typically refer to the current content being iterated in a collection or an array.
Another implementor is the class or one of it's subclasses like or . CurrentContent in the context of refers to the currently displayed content.
CurrentContent may be null on sources that aren't connected through ContentWebForm.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Core.IPageSource.CurrentPage
member.summary: Gets the currently loaded page.
member.value: Returns information about the currently loaded page, or a page in a collection when used inside a control.

remarks.para: The implementation of CurrentPage is strictly up to the implementing class. Some of the templated Web controls implement , and CurrentPage will typically refer to the current page being iterated in a collection or an array.
Another implementor is the class or one of it's subclasses like or . CurrentPage in the context of refers to the currently displayed page.
CurrentPage may be null on sources that aren't connected through PageBase.

member.example:
The following code example demonstrates the usage of CurrentPage.
Response.Write(CurrentPage.PageName);

Example of throwing a exception with error message translated into different languages, see for more information about adding custom language resources.
throw new EPiServerException("My custom error","/customerror/genericfail");

member.name: T:EPiServer.Core.IEnterpriseSettings
member.summary: Defines signatures for handling enterprise configuration settings.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.IEnterpriseSettings.GetSettingsFromContent(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the (Enterprise) settings for a content.
member.param: if set to true, activate fallback to Start page for Settings. See Remarks for more details.
member.returns: A instance for the site that belongs to.

remarks.para: This is done by traversing the page tree upwards from current link until a Page which has an Enterprise config's StartPage set as current page, or the StartPage of the current IIsInstanceId.

If the is not located beneath a start page, the search will fall back to the Settings instance for the current start page if is set to True. If the search fails and fallbackToStartPageId is set to false, the method returns null.

member.exception: Thrown when user does not have enough access right to perform this action.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.IPageStore.MoveToWastebasket(EPiServer.Core.PageReference)
member.summary: Move a page to the Wastebasket
member.param: The link to the page to move
member.exception: Thrown when user does not have enough access right to perform this action.
member.remarks:
Moves a page from its current location into the Recycle Bin. This is the same as doing:
Move(pageLink, EPiServer.Global.EPConfig.Wastebasket, AccessLevel.Delete, AccessLevel.NoAccess); Note: You need Delete access to the page that is being moved.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Core.IPageStore.Copy(EPiServer.Core.PageReference,EPiServer.Core.PageReference,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy a page to another container.
member.param: The link to the page to copy.
The container where the page will be copied
If the new pages should be published on the destination
Run the local copy process on a separate thread (don't work for remote sites).
member.exception: Thrown when user doesnt have enough access right to perform this action
member.remarks: Note, when a page is copied successfully the event is fired, since a page is created in the copy process. But in contrast to the Save method, that also fires the CreatedPage method and always passes an initialized PageData object in the object to the event handler, the Copy method does not. Instead it only passes a pagereference to the copied page and it is up to the handler to load the page data. The reason for this behavior in the Copy method is performance.

member.name: T:EPiServer.DataAbstraction.RuntimeModel.Internal.TemplateModelComparerFactory
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Factory class responsible for creating a for a specific model type.
member.remarks: The default implementation will create a comparer that looks at the inheritance chain for where the for the model type is implemented. And then compare the generic types in the inheritance chain and sort so the model with "shortest" inheritance is inserted before in list. If no is found (e.g. when explicitly registered partial MVC view) it will be considered prioritized, e.g. inserted before the other item in the list.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataFactory.Save(EPiServer.Core.PageData,EPiServer.DataAccess.SaveAction)
member.summary: Save page
member.param: An initialized object containing data to be saved

remarks.para: Note: The action parameter is a SaveAction enumeration that is located in a non-documented part of the SDK. You can however use it as it is a part of the EPiServer API and available from code.
If PageLink is empty a new page will be created

Access right required:
If .Save: if it is new page .Create, if it is new version of the page .Create | .Edit
If .CheckIn: if it is new page and check in is required .Edit, otherwise .Save applies
If .Publish: if pubblishing is required access level is .Publish, otherwise .Save case applies
remarks.example: The following example shows how to programmatically create a page.
The following example shows how to edit and save en existing page.

member.exception: Thrown AccessDeniedException when user doesn't have enough access rights to perform this action

member.summary: Gets the (Enterprise) settings for a content item.

member.name: M:EPiServer.DataFactory.GetSettingsFromContent(EPiServer.Core.ContentReference,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the (Enterprise) settings for a content.
member.param: if set to true, activate fallback to Start page for Settings. See Remarks for more details.
member.returns: A instance for the site that belongs to.

remarks.para: This is done by traversing the page tree upwards from current link until a Page which has an Enterprise config's StartPage set as current page, or the StartPage of the current IIsInstanceId.

If the is not located beneath a start page, the search will fall back to the Settings instance for the current start page if is set to True. If the search fails and fallbackToStartPageId is set to false, the method returns null.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Global
member.summary: Base class for global.asax that supports EPiServer-specific features.

remarks.para: The global.asax.cs file on an EPiServer site should inherit from . This is a requirement for the site to work.

member.example:
The following code example demonstrates the usage of Global to read the BaseDiretory.
BaseDirectory: <%= EPiServer.Global.BaseDirectory %>

member.name: M:EPiServer.Global.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Called to raise event.

member.summary: Called to raise event.

member.summary: Gets or sets the URL rewrite provider.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Global.BaseDirectory
member.summary: The physical root directory where the site is installed, e.g. "D:/INetpub/WWWRoot/Example/", when using Internet Information Services (IIS) folder.
member.remarks: Note: Slashes are used instead of backslashes.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Global.InstanceName
member.summary: IIS Metabase key path for the application, e.g. "_LM_W3SVC_1_ROOT_Example".

remarks.note: Note: Underscore is used instead of slash.

member.summary: Provides an application-wide implementation of the property.
member.param: An object that contains information about the current Web request.
The custom string that specifies which cached response is used to respond to the current request.
member.returns: If the value of the parameter is "path", the requsets path will be returned. If the value of the parameter is "browser", the browser's ; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Global.Init
member.summary: This Init method is called AFTER Application_Start and AFTER the Init methot on HttpModules Executes custom initialization code after all event handler modules have been added.
member.remarks: Note! You cannot count on HttpContext being available - i e do NOT attempt to access it.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Global.RegisterRoutes(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection)
member.summary: Register all the routes needed in order for it to be possible to create CMS templates using MVC. Override this method if you want to replace our routes with custom ones.
member.param: The global collection of routes that is used to lookup the route to a controller/action.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Global.HandleAccessDenied
member.summary: Handles the exception globally by calling .
member.remarks: Even though the method name and its base class suggests it would handle all access denied globally it will only be called for unhandled exceptions of type

member.summary: Code to emulate IIS handling of folders / default documents.

member.summary: Conditionally adds the language if not already present in the list
member.remarks: Any quality indicator will be removed before checking if the language already exists.

member.summary: Conditionally adds a range of language code strings.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Globalization.LanguagePreferenceList.RemoveQualityIndicator(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the quality indicator from a language code.
member.returns: The language code without quality indicator.
member.remarks: A browser may append a quality indicator to the language code to indicate the preference level for a specific language. For example a browser may send "en;q=0.7" and "sv;q=1.0" This means that the highest preference is for Swedish (1.0) and English is second preference. The use of quality indicators is not currently supported, EPiServer simply assumes that language codes are sent in preference order.

member.name: T:EPiServer.PageBase
member.summary: BasePage for EPiServer templates. Supports encoding settings and language translation.
member.remarks:
This class inherits from , which has the core functionality for setting up and rendering a standard Web form (.aspx file.) The PageBase class extends the functionality of the Page class with EPiServer-specific features as access to configuration settings (Configuration property), user information (CurrentUser property) and information about the current EPiServer page (CurrentPage property.)
The PageBase class is an abstract class, meaning it cannot be instantiated. This class is the base class of all template classes in EPiServer. TemplatePage is the most used class as base for Web forms.
PageBase also implements the IPageSource interface, which enables you to retrieve other EPiServer pages easily.
If you use anything apart from templates that inherit from PageBase to create EPiServer page types, no dynamic content will be presented on the Web page.
member.examples: The following code example demonstrates the usage of PageBase.

member.name: M:EPiServer.PageBase.CheckAccess
member.summary: Verify that access control requirements are met for the current web request.
member.remarks:
This method is called as part of the PageBase.OnInit method. It determines the current user's access level and compares it to the current page. If the user does not have sufficient access, the PageBase.AccessDenied method will be called.
Will trigger an AccessDenied if the access requirements are not met.

member.name: M:EPiServer.PageBase.ValidatePageTemplate
member.summary: Makes sure that the right page template is used to present a page.
member.remarks: This method is called as part of the page load process. If a page (as determined by the ID query string parameter on the URL) is accessed with an .aspx file that is not the correct page template file, this method will throw an exception of type EPiServerException. If you have a page type that should be displayed using different page templates, you should override this method and do your custom validation. A validation error should be signalled by throwing an EPiServerException.

member.name: M:EPiServer.PageBase.AccessDenied
member.summary: The method that is invoked when the current users access rights are not suffcient for the operation that he tries to perform.
member.remarks: This method will perform different functions depending on the authentication method in use. If forms authentication is used, then it will redirect the user to the login page as defined in web.config. If windows authentication is used, an Access Denied header (http status 401) will be sent to the client.
member.example: The following code example demonstrates the usage of AccessDenied to deny access to a user that is not logged on. The example is taken from the Web user control LoginStatus.ascx, which is delivered with EPiServer. It must be understood that the click event for ASP.NET Server control Login has been linked to the function Login_Click, so that when the user clicks the Login button, this function is executed. Note that the call to AccessDenied does not necessarily mean that the user is denied access - it can also be used to present the user with a login dialog. This happens in Web user control QuickBar.ascx.

member.name: P:EPiServer.PageBase.CurrentPage
member.summary: Get page data for current page.

remarks.para: A little caution is necessary when using CurrentPage in the HTML part of Web forms, as CurrentPage is implemented from IPageSource and also implements IPageSource. This means that CurrentPage will have different meanings in the same Web form depending on whether it's used outside any included EPiServer Web custom control in general and outside any templated EPiServer Web custom control in particular.

member.name: M:EPiServer.PageBase.GetChildren(EPiServer.Core.PageReference)
member.summary: Retrieves a PageData listing based on supplied argument (from ).

remarks.para: The IPageSource interface is implemented by many classes, such as (and its descendants), , . You typically use the members of this interface to get information about the current page (the CurrentPage property) or use either the GetPage or GetChildren methods to retrieve page data.

IPageSource was created as an interface due to the fact that the GetPage and GetChildren methods normally have the same implementation independently of the class that implements IPageSource. The CurrentPage property has different meanings for different implementations. As an example, CurrentPage on the PageBase class refers to the currently loaded page (based on the ID in the query string).
remarks.note: Note: As IPageSource is an interface, it doesn't implement any of its own attributes or methods itself. This means that you must be aware of which class implementing IPageSource that you're dealing with. For example, PageBase.CurrentPage returns a object for the current page, the same for . However, in a templated control such as EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageList, CurrentPage instead means the current page in the iteration.

member.example: The following code example demonstrates a specialized implementation of IPageSource to set custom access level restrictions to the pages returned.

member.name: M:EPiServer.PageBase.SetCachePolicy
member.summary: Sets the cache policy for this request based on parameters as current user and parameters.
member.remarks:
Override this method if you wish to customize the cache policy for a page. The output cache is turned on based on the following criteria:
1. The EPnCachePolicyTimeout in web.config is > 0.
2. The current user must not be logged on, aka Anonymous.
3. The request must be a GET type request. Hence, Postbacks and form postings will not be cached.
4. The current page must be the published version (the WorkID is == 0).
The cache parameters are fetched from web.config, more specifically the EPsCacheVaryByCustom and EPsCacheVaryByParams settings. Additionally, a dependency to the DataFactoryCache is set. When pages are changed, the cache is flushed. Cache item expiration is set to the HttpCacheExpiration setting, which is the number of seconds the item should reside in the cache, as long as the StopPublish value of the page is not less than the policy timeout (in which case, the StopPublish value is used).

member.name: P:EPiServer.Personalization.EPiServerProfile.EmailWithMembershipFallback
member.summary: Gets the email address of the current user.
member.value: The email address, or null if not defined.

remarks.para: Will first try to get email address from the profile data. If no email address defined, attempt to load email address from the current membership provider.
Note that the membership provider might not be defined or the provider might not support email address information.
In case of error we return null and log information with error level Error.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Personalization.Internal.SubscriptionMail
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. The class that handles sending of mail notifications for subscriptions, used by .
member.remarks:
This subscription handler is going to deliver one subscription mail for each subscription root and language for the subcription, if it exists changed pages for it.
The text for the "Read More..." text is taken from the page property "MailReadMore" on the subscription root.
The subject of the mail is generated from the page property "MailSubject" on the subscription root.
The mail from address generated from the "MailFrom" page property on the subscription root. The stylesheet is taken from the web.config
<episerver xmlns="http://EPiServer.Configuration.EPiServerSection"> <sites> <site description="Example Site"> <siteSettings ... uiEditorCssPaths="~/MyCss.css"

member.name: T:EPiServer.PlugIn.GuiPlugInAttribute
member.summary: Settings for plugins in graphical modes

remarks.para: To translate DisplayName and Description of a plug-in you have to add your own xml file in the lang/ directory and set the property LanguagePath. If you for example set LanguagePath to /myplugin/sample the xml paths you add should be /myplugin/sample/displayname and /myplugin/sample/description.

There may be some plug-ins that requires special security roles or other circumstances that the plug-in framework doesnt have knowledge of, in these cases you may implement ICustomPlugInLoader on you plug-in. This will allow you to control loading of the plug-in yourself.

Some plug-ins need to store some kind of internal settings or state, there are different approaches to this. If you only need to store simple system settings, for example the mail server name in your brand new mail plug-in you probably want to use web.config. If you have large amout of data the obvious choice is to store it in a database. When your need fits in between these two, you need to store small sets of relational data and dont want to use your own database for this simple purpose you have . PlugInSettings is used to store plug-in settings and information in a DataSet, these will be persisted as xml together will the plug-in definition in the EpiServer database.
See class for more information on how the plug-ins are located and matched.

member.example: Sample plug-in that will show up in the administration menu.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory
member.summary: Concrete implementation of the base class, using ActiveDirectory Services Interface (ADSI) to interface with a LDAP server.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.DirectoryServices.AuthenticationTypes,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Create and initialize an instance of this class for accessing Active Directory data.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory.Initialize(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class.
member.remarks:
This method is intended to be called from within a providers Initialize method. It will read its settings from the config parameter and initialize this instance. Required settings in config are: connectionStringName = name of the connection string to use for connecting to the Active Directory server. connectionUsername = username for the connection. connectionPassword = password for the connection.
Optional settings in config are: connectionProtection = level of protection and security for the Active Directory connection. None or Secure (default). cacheTimeout = how long cached Active Directory entries stys in the cache. Default is 10 minutes.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string.
member.remarks: The string for connecting to the Active Directory server. It should be in the format LDAP://dns.name.for.machine or LDAP://dns.name.for.active.directory.domain

member.name: P:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory.Username
member.summary: Gets or sets the user name.
member.remarks: The user name to use for connecting to the Active Directory domain as defined by ConnectionString.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory.GetEntry(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a specific Active Directory entry as a DirectoryData object.
member.returns: A DirectoryData instance containing the properties defined by PropertiesToLoad.
member.remarks: This method uses caching to speed up the operation, if the DirectoryData object is found in the cache, no communication with the Active Directory domain will take place.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory.FindOne(System.String,System.DirectoryServices.SearchScope)
member.summary: Find on Active Directory entry based on search filter.
member.param: The filter, which is a LDAP query.
The scope at which to search.
member.returns: A DirectoryData instance with the entry, or null if the search did not find an entry.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.AdsiDataFactory.FindAll(System.String,System.DirectoryServices.SearchScope,System.String)
member.summary: Finds all directory entries that match the filter criteria.
member.param: The property to sort directory entries by.
member.returns: An IList of DirectoryData objects, sorted by the indicated property.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.DirectoryDataFactory.Initialize(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class.
member.remarks:
This method is intended to be called from within a providers Initialize method. It will read its settings from the config parameter and initialize this instance. Required settings in config are: connectionStringName = name of the connection string to use for connecting to the Active Directory server. connectionUsername = username for the connection. connectionPassword = password for the connection.
Optional settings in config are: connectionProtection = level of protection and security for the Active Directory connection. None or Secure (default). cacheTimeout = how long cached Active Directory entries stys in the cache. Default is 10 minutes.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.Internal.VirtualRoleHelper.GetRoleNameForClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Gets the virtual role name for the specified class (if many exists you may receive any of them)
member.returns: The role name.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.Internal.VirtualRoleHelper.GetAllVirtualRoles
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Get a list of all virtual roles.
member.returns: A string array with the virtual role names.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.Internal.VirtualRoleHelper.GetAllRoles
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Gets all virtual roles and all roles defined by the Role provider.
member.returns: A string array with all role names.
member.remarks: If you want to get a list of all roles, both from the Roles provider and virtual roles, use this method since it will filter out any duplicates caused by overloading role names from virtual roles. I e if you have a virtual role named "Administrators" and Roles.GetAllRoles() contains an entry named "Administrators" the final array returned by this method will only contain a single reference to the "Administrators" name.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.Internal.VirtualRoleHelper.SearchRoles(System.String)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Find virtual roles and roles defined by the Role provider.
member.returns: A list of roles that match the roleName

remarks.para: Matching of role names is simply a substring check - if the role contains the string passed in roleName anywhere in the string, it is considered a match. A Null or empty roleName will return all roles.

If you want to get a list of roles from the Roles provider and virtual roles, use this method since it will filter out any duplicates caused by overloading role names from virtual roles. I e if you have a virtual role named "Administrators" and Roles.GetAllRoles() contains an entry named "Administrators" the final enumerator returned by this method will only contain a single reference to the "Administrators" name.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.Internal.VirtualRoleHelper.GetAllRolesForUser(System.String)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Gets all available roles for a user.
member.returns: An enumberable of strings with the names of all available roles for the user, regardless if she is a member of the role or not.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Security.VirtualRoles
member.summary: Handles the virtual role configuration and role checks for registered providers.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.VirtualRoles.GetRoleNameForClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the virtual role name for the specified class (if many exists you may receive any of them)
member.returns: The role name.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.VirtualRoles.GetAllVirtualRoles
member.summary: Get a list of all virtual roles.
member.returns: A string array with the virtual role names.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.VirtualRoles.GetAllRoles
member.summary: Gets all virtual roles and all roles defined by the Role provider.
member.returns: A string array with all role names.
member.remarks: If you want to get a list of all roles, both from the Roles provider and virtual roles, use this method since it will filter out any duplicates caused by overloading role names from virtual roles. I e if you have a virtual role named "Administrators" and Roles.GetAllRoles() contains an entry named "Administrators" the final array returned by this method will only contain a single reference to the "Administrators" name.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.VirtualRoles.GetAllRolesForUser(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all available roles for a user.
member.returns: A string array with the names of all available roles for the user, regardless if she is a member of the role or not.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.VirtualRoles.IsPrincipalInVirtualRole(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified principal is in the virtual role
member.returns: true if the specified principal is in the virtual role; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Security.VirtualRoles.IsReplacePrincipal
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether we will replace the current principal with a VirtualRolePrincipal.
member.value: true if we will replace the current principal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Security.VirtualRoles.SearchRoles(System.String)
member.summary: Search in virtual roles and roles defined by the Role provider.
member.returns: A list of roles that match the roleName

remarks.para: Matching of role names is simply a substring check - if the role contains the string passed in roleName anywhere in the string, it is considered a match. A Null or empty roleName will return all roles.

If you want to get a list of roles from the Roles provider and virtual roles, use this method since it will filter out any duplicates caused by overloading role names from virtual roles. I e if you have a virtual role named "Administrators" and Roles.GetAllRoles() contains an entry named "Administrators" the final enumerator returned by this method will only contain a single reference to the "Administrators" name.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Security.WindowsMembershipProvider.DeletePrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the delete prefixes.
member.remarks:
When reading the Windows groups there are some group names that have prefixes that you may want to remove. For example the Administrators group is reported as "BUILTIN\Administrators" and by setting the DeletePrefix to "BUILTIN\" the group will instead be reported as "Administrators".
The primary way to set this property is by setting the attribute deletePrefix for the membership provider configuration in web.config. The attribute is a comma-separated string with the prefixes to check.

member.param: The friendly name of the provider.
A collection of the name/value pairs representing the provider-specific attributes specified in the configuration for this provider.
member.exception: The name of the provider is null.
An attempt is made to call on a provider after the provider has already been initialized.
The name of the provider has a length of zero.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Security.WindowsMembershipProvider.ApplicationName
member.summary: The name of the application using the custom membership provider.
member.returns: The name of the application using the custom membership provider.
member.remarks: The current implementation ignores the ApplicationName. All users are placed in the same store regardless of the ApplicationName. Since the windows account database is the same regardless of the application in use it makes no sense to partition the user store.

member.name: M:EPiServer.UriSupport.EscapeUriSegments(System.String)
member.summary: Converts all characters, except RFC 2396 reserved except '?' and unreserved characters, to their hexadecimal representation. This is equivalent to escaping all but RFC 2396 pchar characters in an abs_path. Use this method to escape paths in URI's. All Unicode characters are converted to UTF-8 format before being escaped. There must be no escaped characters in the string.
member.returns: The encoded representation
member.remarks: This method differs from Uri.EscapeUriString in that it also encodes '#', which although documented as doing, Uri.EscapeUriString does not. This is either a code-defect or a documentation issue in .NET framework 2.0. It also differs in that it encodes '?' and '&', wich Uri.EscapeUriString does not claim to do, nor does. Note that this method does not allow the use of '/' in the separate segments. Use System.Uri.UnescapeDataString to get the original string back.

member.name: M:EPiServer.UriSupport.Split(System.String)
member.summary: Splits the specified escaped URL into three parts: [0] - The [scheme][host][path] portion - before any fragment or query [1] - The query, if any, including the '?' [2] - The fragment, if any, including the '#'
member.returns: A string[3] array with the parts, or empty strings if no such part

member.name: M:EPiServer.UriSupport.SplitNoDelim(System.String)
member.summary: Splits the specified escaped URL into three parts: [0] - The [scheme][host][path] portion - before any fragment or query [1] - The query, if any, excluding the '?' [2] - The fragment, if any, excluding the '#'
member.returns: A string[3] array with the parts, or empty strings if no such part

member.returns: True if the string follows a data URI pattern; otherwise false.

member.name: T:EPiServer.UserControlBase
member.summary: A utility class to simplify the code in user controls.

remarks.para: UserControlBase is to EPiServer Web user controls what PageBase is to EPiServer page templates - it provides access to the EPiServer infrastructure. Letting a Web user control inherit EPiServer.UserControlBase instead of the default UserControl turns the standard User Control class into a fully-fledged EPiServer Universe member, with access to EPiServer Web pages and current configuration settings, among other things.

By inheriting from the UserControlBase class you do not have to cast the Page property of the UserControl class to a PageBase class. Instead use the CurrentPage and the other members like you would directly from PageBase or TemplatePage.
The purpose is to give access to frequently used methods and properties of the PageBase class without having to cast the Page property.
remarks.note: This class does not implement IPageSource, even though it mimics the interface by having all the IPageSource methods. The reason for this is that if UserControlBase really implemented IPageSource, it would cause controls such as Property to become contained and non-editable via dope.

member.example: The following example demonstrates how to inherit from the UserControlBase class.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.CachedUrlHandler
member.summary: Handler for cached URL rewrite requests.

remarks.para: A class deriving from CachedUrlHandler can implement the IHandleUrlForRewrite interface. Usually you will have some overlap in functionality between the RewriteFromCachedData method and the TryHandleUrl method on IHandleUrlForRewrite and thus implemeting that interface on the handler class usually makes sense.

NOTE! If you do implement the interface on a CachedUrlHandler instance you should conceptually (and usually in practice) treat the IHandleUrlForRewrite and CachedUrlHandler as distinct and disjunct objects.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.CachedUrlHandler.RewriteFromCachedData(EPiServer.Web.UrlRewriteContext,System.Object@)
member.summary: Rewrites the URL from cached data.
member.returns: True if the URL was rewritten, false otherwise.
member.remarks: You may optionally return an internal representation of the page in internalObject. This will usually be a PageReference, but you should always check the type and not assume that it is a PageReference since internalObject may contain anything depending on the actual CachedUrlHandler implementation.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.Routing.EditUrlArguments.ForceEditHost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to force the use of a edit host if present (but never primary site hosts)

remarks.para: The primary use case for this property is linking to edit mode from templates.
Note that the edit host will always be preferred if requested edit URL isn't for the current site.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.Routing.EditUrlArguments.ForceHost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to force the use of a site host (prefers edit hosts but fallbacks to primary host)

remarks.para: The primary use case for this property is linking from external systems, such as links in e-mails.
If language is specified hosts from the specified language will used, but fallbacks to hosts not locked to languages.
Note that if no site can be detected an URL without host will be returned, use an overload that takes to be sure a host can be resolved.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.Routing.EditUrlArguments.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific language that should be requested.
member.remarks: This property will add language information to the URL but also try to select a language specific host if matched with ForceHost property.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.Routing.IPartialRouter`2
member.summary: Defines the signature for a component that extends routing to .

remarks.para: TContent specifies for which content types this implementation can partially route. An example would be an url like 'http://sitehost/aPage/extendedPart/extendedContent/'. If there is a page matching url 'http://sitehost/aPage/' then if the page can be assigned to TContent the instance of IPartialRouter can be called to route the part 'extendedPart/extendedContent/'.

TRoutedData specifies for which content types this implementation can extend outgoing url for. An example would be the generation of an url like 'http://sitehost/aPage/extendedPart/extendedContent/'. If TRoutedData is assignable for the type matching extendedContent then this instance can be called to generate a partial virtual path.

member.example: The below example is a partial router that routes URLs like 'http://sitehost/News/Sport/A%20News/'. In the example the URL part 'http://sitehost/News/' is to a page of type NewsContainer (the reference to that page is given by field _newsContainer) while the part 'Sport/A%20News' is handled by the partial router.
member.typeparam: The type of for which routing can be extended.
The type of for which outgoing URL generation can be extended.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.Routing.IPartialRouter`2.RoutePartial(`0,EPiServer.Web.Routing.Segments.SegmentContext)
member.summary: Implement to take care of partial routing below a routed content instance.

remarks.para: During routing of an incoming request first the url will be parsed from left for pages as long as there is matches. If there is a remaining part (not matched by any page) after page routing then there is a check if there is any IPartialRouter registered for the the type of the found page. If so that implementation is called to se if it can route the remaining part.

An example would be an url like http://sitehost/aPage/extendedPart/extendedContent/. If there is a page matching url http://sitehost/aPage/ then if an IPartialRouter is registered for the type matching aPage that instance will be called to route the part extendedPart/extendedContent/.
Most commonly the returned data is of type TRoutedData. But there might be cases where it is something else, an example is in the Relate package where the returned object is in parameter .

member.example: The below example is a partial router that routes URLs like 'http://sitehost/News/Sport/A%20News/'. In the example the URL part 'http://sitehost/News/' is to a page of type NewsContainer while the part 'Sport/A%20News' is handled by the partial router.
member.param: The content that the page route has been able to route to.
The segment context containing the remaining part of url.
member.returns: A to the mathced data or null if the remaining part did not match.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.Routing.IPartialRouter`2.GetPartialVirtualPath(`1,System.String,System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary,System.Web.Routing.RequestContext)
member.summary: Gets a partial virtual path for a content item during routing.
member.param: The content to generate a virtual path for.
The language to generate the url for.
member.returns: A containing the partial virtual path for the content and a to the item to get base path from or null if the remaining part did not match.

remarks.para: During construction of an URL for a instance there is a check if any IPartialRouter instance is registered for the type of the content. If so the IPartialRouter instance is called to generate a partial path of the URL.

An example would be the generation of an url like http://sitehost/aPage/extendedPart/extendedContent/. If there is an IPartialRouter registered for the type matching extendedContent that instance will be called to generate a partial virtual path. In the example the implementation could return as 'extendedPart/extendedContent/' and set as a reference to the page that matches the url http://sitehost/aPage/.

member.example: The below example is a partial router that generates partial URLs like 'Sport/A%20News/'. In the example the URL part 'http://sitehost/News/' is to a page of type NewsContainer the reference to that page is given by field _newsContainer. The part 'Sport/A%20News' is handled by the partial router.

If the content is on the same site, the canonical URL will only be returned if the current hostname is set to be redirected.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.HierarchicalUrlRewriteProvider.ConvertToExternalInternal(EPiServer.UrlBuilder,System.Object,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Converts from internal EPiServer classic to the external 'friendly' URL representation. This is the only method that defines this mapping. It includes all globally valid rules for this transformation in the context of EPiServer, but not rules dependent on for example on the current running mode, i.e. view mode, edit mode etc or similar. The conversion must take language preferences into account when determining language.
member.param: The internal representation of the object, if any. Typically it may be a PageReference.
member.returns: True if any changes done to the url, False otherwise.
member.remarks: This is the only method that defines this mapping. It includes all globally valid rules for this transformation in the context of EPiServer, but not rules dependent on for example on the current running mode, i.e. view mode, edit mode etc or similar. The conversion must take language preferences into account when determining language.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.IHandleUrlForRewrite
member.summary: Interface for handling URL rewriting in the .
member.remarks: This interface handles non-cached requests for a specific URL

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.IHandleUrlForRewrite.TryHandleUrl(EPiServer.Web.UrlRewriteContext,System.Object@,EPiServer.Web.CachedUrlHandler@)
member.summary: Tries to handle the URL gven in the context.
member.param: The context for the rewrite. Note that the URL of the context may be modified.
member.returns: True if the URL was recognized and handled, False otherwise.

remarks.para: If this method returns False (URL not handled), then the context, internalObject and handler should be unaffected.

If the method returns True (URL handled), then UrlRewritten will indicate if the context.Url property has been modified. The method may optionally return a CachedUrlHandler in the handler parameter in this case as well.
Returning a non-null value in handler is how you indicate that you have want to cache expensive url lookups and reuse for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.IHandleUrlForRewrite.UrlRewritten
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the URL was rewritten as a result of the TryHandleUrl method.
member.value: true if URL was rewritten; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.InitializationModule
member.summary: Initialization of the EPiServer CMS runtime.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.InitializationModule.HostType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the host.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.InitializationModule.Initialize(EPiServer.Framework.Initialization.InitializationEngine)
member.summary: Initializes this instance.
member.remarks: Gets called as part of the EPiServer Framework initialization sequence. Note that it will be called only once per AppDomain, unless the method throws an exception. If an exception is thrown, the initialization method will be called repeadetly for each request reaching the site until the method succeeds.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.InitializationModule.Uninitialize(EPiServer.Framework.Initialization.InitializationEngine)
member.summary: Resets the module into an uninitialized state.

remarks.para: This method is usually not called when running under a web application since the web app may be shut down very abruptly, but your module should still implement it properly since it will make integration and unit testing much simpler.
Any work done by as well as any code executing on should be reversed.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.Internal.HierarchicalUrlHandler.TryHandleUrl(EPiServer.Web.UrlRewriteContext,System.Object@,EPiServer.Web.CachedUrlHandler@)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Tries to handle the URL gven in the context.
member.param: The context for the rewrite. Note that the URL of the context may be modified.
member.returns: True if the URL was recognized and handled, False otherwise.

remarks.para: If this method returns False (URL not handled), then the context, internalObject and handler should be unaffected.

If the method returns True (URL handled), then UrlRewritten will indicate if the context.Url property has been modified. The method may optionally return a CachedUrlHandler in the handler parameter in this case as well.
Returning a non-null value in handler is how you indicate that you have want to cache expensive url lookups and reuse for subsequent calls.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.Internal.HtmlRewriteStream
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Stream used while parsing outgoing HTML

remarks.para: Use this as a Response.Filter-filter. It will parse outgoing HTML and find links to the site and transform them to friendly urls and/or language-specifying urls according to what was done during the rewriting of the original request. It is dependent on information in Context.Item-collection to determine just how the rewriting is to occur. This is set by UrlRewriteModule normally.

For efficiency reasons, this stream will primarily attempt to buffer in memory first, and failing that, should switch over to a separate intermediary threaded pipe-implementation (not yet implemented).

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.Internal.OutputCacheHandler
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Handles output cache settings. Used from in WebForms and in MVC.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.Internal.OutputCacheHandler.SetCachePolicy(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal,EPiServer.Core.ContentReference,System.Web.HttpContextBase,EPiServer.Configuration.Settings,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Sets the cache policy for this request based on parameters as current user and parameters.
member.remarks:
Override this method if you wish to customize the cache policy for a page. The output cache is turned on based on the following criteria:
1. The EPnCachePolicyTimeout in web.config is > 0.
2. The current user must not be logged on, aka Anonymous.
3. The request must be a GET type request. Hence, Postbacks and form postings will not be cached.
4. The current page must be the published version (the WorkID is == 0).
The cache parameters are fetched from web.config, more specifically the EPsCacheVaryByCustom and EPsCacheVaryByParams settings. Additionally, a dependency to the DataFactoryCache is set. When pages are changed, the cache is flushed. Cache item expiration is set to the HttpCacheExpiration setting, which is the number of seconds the item should reside in the cache, as long as the StopPublish value of the page is not less than the policy timeout (in which case, the StopPublish value is used).

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.Internal.TemplatePathResolver.ResolvePath(System.Type,EPiServer.Framework.Web.TemplateTypeCategories)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Resolves the path for the requested render type.
member.returns: returns path to the render template.
member.remarks: The ResolvePath resolves path by following order 1. Resolves path by raising ResolvingTemplatePath event 2. Resolves path from root of application according to namespace e.g. if the namespace is like A.B.C and the typename is X then the searching paths are (~/A/B/C/X, ~/B/C/X, ~/C/X, ~/X) 3. Resolves path from root of corresponding Shell module according to namespace e.g. if the namespace is like A.B.C, typename is X and the Shell module path is M then the searching paths are (~/M/A/B/C/X, ~/M/B/C/X, ~/M/C/X, ~/M/X)

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.Internal.UpdatePanelPostBackRewritePipe.RewriteToEnd(System.IO.TextReader,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Rewrites the source stream to the end, sending the result to the writer. The implementation will look for occurrences of format content.length|type|id|content| which is the output from UpdatePanel. For found occurrences the content part will be parsed for links which will be rewritten to FURL format. The output is in the same format as from the UpdatePanel but with FURL links.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.Mvc.ContentController`1
member.summary: Provides the base implementation for for content controllers.
member.remarks:
The ContentController class is small, containing only a few methods and properties for handling three basic tasks:
Support for access checks.
Support for handling actions that are not available in the controller.
Setting up the capability of impersonating visitor groups.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.Mvc.ContentOutputCacheAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that can be used to specify that the output from a action should be put in output cache.
member.remarks:
This attibute cannot be used on child actions. The reason for this is that in MVC child actions are output cached in a memory cache and hence the output cache will not be invalidated when a content is changed.
The output cache is turned on based on the following criteria:
1. The httpCacheExpiration in web.config is > 0.
2. The current user must not be logged on, aka Anonymous.
3. The request must be a GET type request. Hence, Postbacks and form postings will not be cached.
4. The current content must be the published version (the WorkID is == 0).
Some cache parameters are fetched from configruation if not present on attribute. More specifically if Duration is 0 then the httpCacheExpiration (on element/episerver/sites/site/SiteSetting) value from web.config is used. And if VaryByCustom is null or empty then httpCacheVaryByCustom (on element/episerver/sites/site/SiteSetting) value from web.config is used. Cache item expiration is set to the httpCacheExpiration setting, which is the number of seconds the item should reside in the cache, as long as the IVersionable.StopPublish value of the content is not less than the policy timeout (in which case, the StopPublish value is used).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.remarks: This value is mainly used when a baseclass specifies that output cache should be used, then a subclass can put the attribute with Disable=true to prevent output cache to be used for the subclass.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.Mvc.Html.PropertyExtensions.BeginEditSection(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Writes the required attribute to make an html element editable (when in edit mode).
BeginEditSection/EndEditSection should be used instead of EditAttributes when rendering a block or inside partial views for blocks.
The difference between EditAttributes and BeginEditSection/EndEditSection is that when using BeginEditSection then no other edit hints for nested properties will be written out before EndEditSection is called.
member.returns: The required attribute to make an html element editable.
member.remarks: This should be used together with EndEditSection.

member.returns: The required attribute to make an html element editable.
member.remarks: This should be used together with EndEditSection.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.Mvc.PageController`1
member.summary: Provides the base implementation for for page controllers.
member.remarks:
The PageControllerBase class is small, containing only a few methods and properties for handling three basic tasks:
Providing easy access to the instance for the current request.
Support for handling actions that are not available in the controller.
Setting up the capability of impersonating visitor groups.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.PageExtensions.PageTranslation.TranslateSingleControl(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Called to translate UI text for controls
member.returns: True if the control was of a type that can be translated
member.remarks:
This method can be overridden to support custom controls that needs translation support. It currently supports
EPiServer.Core.ITranslateLocalizedText property
System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputButtonValue property
System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCellInnerText property
System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonText property
System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLinkText property
System.Web.UI.WebControls.LabelText property
System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButtonText property
The method currently dont support System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal since literal control inherits from control class directly not from webcontrol. This makes it not possible to manipulate attributes on Literal control. Instead use Resources or a Label control for translation.
For all controls that do not support the ITranslate interface, the translation mechanism uses the attribute "translate" to collect the translatable string. It will then set the indicated property of the control to the translated string.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Web.PageExtensions.PageTranslation.TranslateExplicitControl(EPiServer.Core.ITranslate)
member.summary: Called to translate a control implementing . The implementation will check to see if control implements and if so use and to do the translation. Else if control not implements the translation will be performed using

member.summary: Translates that has translate attribute. Supported controls are , and

member.summary: Translates all controls on the page.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.UrlRewriteModuleBase
member.summary: Responsible for raising appropriate events for mapping between internal and external formats of the request URLs.
member.remarks: Will parse outgoing HTML, and incoming and outgoing special urls and parameter strings, raising the appropriate events implemented by the implementation derived classes. It is this modules responsibility to identify all necessary urls for rewriting in one or the other direction. The descendant class must provide the actual rewriting functionality.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.UrlRewriteProvider
member.summary: Provide basic URL rewrite functionality, mapping to and from an internal format.
member.remarks: The mapping performed is context-free in the sense that it just maps from internal or to internal, it does not rebase relative URLs dependning on the internal and external requesting context URL.

example.para: Get a friendly URL for the given PageData object. Returns the friendly Url for the given PageData object.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageControlBase
member.summary: Serves as a base class for all controls that generate any type of collection.

remarks.para: Classes that derive from PageControlBase have very rich data binding support. First they support .NET data binding to for example and .

Second, PageControlBase supports data binding itself to another data source to extend its data. Can be very useful to serializing data through different controls using different filters, for example when you need to split data delivered from a EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageList into two different controls. You may also find that data delivered from one control would be better rendered using an other control.

member.example:
Simple example showing how data is read and displayed on a page. The PageLink specifies which page the list will be retrieved from.
Illustrates how data from one control can be used by several other controls, in this example it is only PageList1 that delivers data and the others are only used for presentation.

member.name: E:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageControlBase.Filter
member.summary: Filters adding,removing or changing order of pages

remarks.para: Filters can be called multiple times on different collections and should not contain any state.

If you add your own FilterPropertySort to the filter queue, make sure to set SortBy = null, otherwise the webcontrol's default sort filter is also executed and it would resort the data, since it is always executed last.

member.summary: Controls if paging is used. Set to true to enable paging.

remarks.para: By default paging is disabled.
If you are using paging in your PageListData control and you are using a data binding expression make sure to manually DataBind it as we cannot guarantee that works.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageListData.PagesPerPagingItem
member.summary: Number of pages that goes into one paging item. The default value is same as .
member.example: For example, if PagesPerPagingItem is 12, each paging item will list up to 12 pages.

remarks.para: This property overrides any similar values provided in any control defined in the property.
If you are using a data binding expression for this property, you need to manually DataBind this control as we cannot guarantee that works.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageListData.CurrentPagingItemIndex
member.summary:
Storage for the PagingControl's CurrentPagingItemIndex property. Since the children are deleted during databind (and the PagingControl is one of the children), we need to store the index in the parent, ie this control.
The value is zero-bound (0 means first paging item, 1 is second paging item, and so on).

remarks.para: This value is stored in control state.
If you are using a data binding expression for this property, you need to manually DataBind this control as we cannot guarantee that works.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageListData.PagingControl

member.summary: Text representation of page.
member.value: Returns a String with preview of the page.
member.remarks:
The preview text is determined by the following:
If the page has a MainIntro property, this string is returned.
If the page has a MainBody property, the first 400 characters of MainBody is returned with all HTML-formatting removed.
Otherwise an empty string is returned.

member.value: true if control should DataBind automatically; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageTreeData.ExpandAll
member.summary: Expand all tree nodes.

remarks.para: If ExpandAll is false, the branch where CurrentPage is located in is expanded. To find the right branch a search is being made from CurrentPage and up, towards the root page. Note, if a non-published page is encountered during the search and the current user is not allowed to access the page, the search fails and a login prompt is shown to the user.

If ExpandAll is true, all branches are expanded. The pages in the tree are crawled from top to bottom. If a non-published page is encountered in a branch and the current user is not allowed to access the page, that particular branch is not expanded any further.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageTreeData.PublishedStatus
member.summary: Set or get the level of "publish status" filtering that will be done.
member.remarks: By default it will be set to Published, i e only pages that are published and is within the valid publish date range will be included.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageTreeData.RequiredAccess
member.summary: Set or get the level of access rights filtering that will be done.
member.remarks: By default it will be set to AccessLevel.Read, i e only pages that you have read access to will be included.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PageTreeData.PageSource
member.summary: Set or get where pages will be fetched from, defaults to base page on databind.
member.remarks: Normally you never need to modify PageSource, it will automatically be set.

member.name: P:EPiServer.Web.WebControls.PagingControl.AutoPaging
member.summary: Defines whether paging should be turned on or off, depending on how many paging items are generated. If the value is true, paging is turned off when there is at most 1 paging item, that holds all pages. If the value is false, paging items are always shown, even if there is just one paging item that shows all pages, the paging items is displayed. By default the value is true, that is, show no more than needed.

member.param: The internal representation of the object, if any. Typically it may be a PageReference.
member.returns: True if any changes done to the url, False otherwise.

It includes all globally valid rules for this transformation in the context of EPiServer, but not rules dependent on for example on the current running mode, i.e. view mode, edit mode etc or similar. The conversion must take language preferences into account when determining language.

member.name: T:EPiServer.Extensions.Internal.TypeExtensions
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Extension methods that find interceptable Type and PropertyInfo.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Extensions.Internal.TypeExtensions.IsInterceptableType(System.Type)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Determines whether [is interceptable type] [the specified t].
member.remarks:
An interceptable type has following criteria
1- Should have both Getter and Setter CompilerGenerated property
2- The CompilerGenerated property should be virtual and Public
3- The CompilerGenerated property's DeclaringType should be same as ReflectedType
member.returns: true if [is interceptable type] [the specified t]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:EPiServer.Extensions.Internal.TypeExtensions.InterceptableProperties(System.Type)
member.summary: Unsupported INTERNAL API! Not covered by semantic versioning; might change without notice. Return Interceptables properties.
member.remarks:
A property is interceptable if has the following creiteria
1- the property have both Getter and Setter CompilerGenerated accessor
2- The property should be virtual and Public
3- The property's DeclaringType should be same as ReflectedType
member.returns: Interceptable PropertyInfo

member.name: T:Sgml.CaseFolding
member.summary: SGML is case insensitive, so here you can choose between converting to lower case or upper case tags. "None" means that the case is left alone, except that end tags will be folded to match the start tags.
